home.errorMsg: Unable to connect to the query backend or an unknown error occurred.

embed.noServerIpMsg: The server IP parameter is required in the URL.
embed.unableConnectMsg: Unable to connect to the query backend.
embed.offlineMsg: Server is not responding or does not exist.

docs.title: API Documentation
docs.subtitle: Easily integrate Minecraft server status into your applications with our API.

status.description: Get the full real-time status of a server, returned in JSON format. This is the base endpoint for all data.
status.paramIp: The IP address or domain name of the server. (e.g., play.example.com)
status.paramPort: The server port. If left blank, default ports will be used for probing.
status.paramHost: Address in ip:port format. This will be ignored if ip and port are provided.
status.paramStype: Query type. Options: auto (default), je (Java only), be (Bedrock only).
status.paramSrv: Set to true to resolve SRV records. (e.g., ?srv=true)
status.paramIcon: A URL for a custom icon. This will be returned in the response, mainly for image generation.

statusImg.description: Dynamically generate a PNG image based on the server's real-time status.
statusImg.supportsParams: This endpoint supports all parameters from /api/status, plus the following:
statusImg.paramTheme: A preset theme for the image. If left blank, the default theme (simple) will be used.

tester.title: Interactive API Tester
tester.description: Build your request and see the results in real-time here.

apiTester.placeholder: The JSON response will be displayed here after sending a request.
apiTester.imageHint: The image will update in real-time based on the configuration above.

embedG.title: Embed into Your Website
embedG.description: Adjust the options below for a live preview, then copy the generated code.

imgG.title: Generate Status Image URL
imgG.description: Copy the link below to use in forum signatures or Markdown documents.

joinM.title: About to Join Server
joinM.body1: We will launch your local Minecraft Bedrock Edition client and automatically add the server details.
joinM.warning1: If you have both the global and NetEase versions installed,
joinM.body2: If you don't have the client yet, click the button below to download. If the game doesn't launch, check your browser permissions or try another browser.

serverDis.initialPrompt: Enter a server address to begin querying.
